text: Hello everyone :blush: I'm having the same question as <@U017FDXJVBJ>. Should I do anything else after submitting the form (submitted the form last week) with the link to my template? When and how will I be notified about the results? Also, do you have any other certified course recommendations for a HubSpot / Development noobie?  Been playing around with HTML, CSS, custom HubSpot modules & templates for a while and looking forward to deepen my knowledge in a more systematic way.
i think i used flexbox to style mine.
Hi, anyone can help me with the development of template with "dnd"? I am using the dnd syntax but I don't have any output.....
<@U01EHATCSTB>, I did the same exercise and I used flexbox. You have to change flex-direction from "row" to "column" and then you should use media queries.

I'm beginning with Hubl and i have a question. Is Hubl compatible with Semantic HTML?

I mean, like:

`<div class="demo-two-col">`
   `<article class="col text">` 
      `{% inline_text field="feature_text" value="{{ module.feature_text }}" %}`
   `</article>`
   `<figure class="col image">`
      `{% if module.feature_image.src %}`
         `<img src="{{ module.feature_image.src }}" alt="{{ module.feature_image.alt }}">`
      `{% endif %}`
   `</figure>`
`</div>`
<@U01DW9WUYDB> just checked out your work. Looks great, you should be all set! Sorry that submission process is confusing. We are working on it.

Hi Jean! The short answer is yes. If you want to discuss options for using HubL with various markup strategies I might suggest the <#C2YH119N2|hubl> channel or even start a discussion in the general channel. Lots of folks have done all manner of projects and would love to chat.
Thank you! :relaxed: I was worried I  had missed something. Many thanks for your time spent on creating these courses. :pray:
